title: ASL 5.5 ‚Äî Space & Role Shift (Dialogue Paths, Eye Gaze, Returns) üé≠
objectives: Assign and reuse spatial anchors (loci) for people/places to keep narratives readable
Use ROLE-SHIFT (RS) with clear eye gaze and body shift to mark who is speaking/acting
Return to neutral narrator efficiently and keep clauses compact (3‚Äì5 signs) with time-first when helpful

vocab.def: Fixed point in space for a referent (PERSON-A left, PERSON-B right, PLACE up-right).
Point to a locus for HE/SHE/THEY as needed; reuse consistently.
Small shoulder/torso shift + eye gaze toward the anchored character.
Briefly acting as a character (e.g., walk, open-door) inside RS.
Pop back to centered narrator stance between lines.
A ‚Üê‚Üí B exchange mapped in space with consistent gaze and turns.
Lead with PAST/TODAY/FUTURE to set when before who/what.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Anchor Map
sections.body: Set **A** on your left, **B** on your right, **PLACE** up-right. Point once to name each, then keep reusing the exact points.

options: Reuse the same point for the same referent

callouts.title: Tiny, Not Huge
callouts.body: Anchors live close to neutral space‚Äîsmall, repeatable points are easiest to track.

sections.heading: Model: RS Lines + Neutral

media.alt: RS to A, return, RS to B
media.caption: RS‚ÜíA line ‚Ä¢ neutral ‚Ä¢ RS‚ÜíB line

sections.body:
Pattern:
‚Ä¢ **Narrator (neutral):** **TODAY A MEET B PLACE.**
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíA (eyes to B locus):** **HI.**
‚Ä¢ **Neutral:** **B ANSWER.**
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíB (eyes to A locus):** **HELLO NICE-MEET-YOU.**
Always **return to neutral** between character lines.

microCheck.q: After a character line in RS you should‚Ä¶
options: Stay in RS for the next line

sections.heading: Dialogue Paths: A ‚Üî B
sections.body:
Keep a clean **A ‚Üî B** path. Eye gaze targets the **other** person‚Äôs locus while in RS. Use small head turns, not full torso swings. Example:
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíA:** **YOU (to B) HELP-me?** (Y/N face)
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíB:** **YES HELP.**

callouts.title: Don‚Äôt Drift
callouts.body: If B‚Äôs locus slides over time, reset it with a quick point before continuing.

microCheck.q: While RS‚ÜíA, where do your eyes look for a question to B?

sections.heading: Constructed Action (CA): Short & Clear
sections.body: Use **brief** CA to show actions: **RS‚ÜíA** opens-door; return to neutral to narrate: **A OPEN-DOOR FINISH.** Keep CA 1‚Äì2 seconds‚Äîdon‚Äôt wander.

callouts.title: Time-First for Scenes
callouts.body: Start with **PAST / TODAY / FUTURE** to frame before RS.

options: Brief action + quick return to neutral

sections.heading: Partner Practice: 4-Line Mini Dialogue
sections.body:
Build **four lines** with anchors and RS:
1) **Neutral:** **TODAY A MEET B.**
2) **RS‚ÜíA:** **WHAT‚ÄôS-UP?**
3) **RS‚ÜíB:** **BUSY RECENT.**
4) **RS‚ÜíA:** **NEED HELP?** (Y/N face)
Swap roles. Keep each line **3‚Äì5 signs**.

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **12‚Äì18s**: A ‚Üî B mini-dialogue with **time-first**, **two RS lines**, and **clear neutral returns**. Example: **TODAY A MEET B. (RS‚ÜíA) LONG-TIME-NO-SEE. (RS‚ÜíB) SAME! (RS‚ÜíA) LATER CHAT?**
sections.teacherNote: Allow privacy submissions; caption should list your **A/B anchor locations**.

items.prompt: Which cue helped most‚Äîeye gaze, neutral returns, or compact clauses? What will you drill?
